section.title: System Studio Overview
section.para: System Studio is a free, open source application and framework to create RPM package repositories for use with CentOS and Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
System Studio allows creating two types of repositories - system and package.

System repositories, also known as custom distributions, are useful for system administrators who wish to deploy CentOS or Red Hat Enterprise Linux within their organizations, but with added, or removed, packages and modified default configuration.

Package repositories are useful for independent software vendors (ISVs) and system administrators who wish to deliver software that can be easily deployed and updated using standard operating system tools.

System Studio automates common repository creation tasks:
Builds packages starting from SRPMs or from user-provided files and scripts.
Downloads packages from existing package repositories.
Signs created packages.
Creates repository metadata.
Tests system installation and updates.
